content.description: Start by weaving a line through a tricky jug section up to the vegetated ledge below the corner. Do a fun reachy move, and carefully pass a horrible thorn bush. Continue up the awesome, right-facing dihedral, being cautious of where you are grabbing (lots of dookey in some places, but super easy to completely avoid.). Climb into cleaner and increasingly overhanging terrain, and pull through the crux and onto the easy slab on top. There are lots of objective hazards, but it is a very fun climb if you're good sneaking past choss, thorn bushes, and poo.
content.protection: There are a few strangely placed bolts on top of the formation as well as a giant rock horn you can sling to build TR anchors. Many bolt studs, nails, and other remnants exist on top. I originally TR soloed this, but I believe we later came back and set a TR with a 70m.
content.location: Start left of the small "Fly Cave", and climb the right-facing corner at about 60' up.

content.description:
Start left of

Unknown Corner

behind the bushes. Climb up and right into a left-facing corner. Climb up the corner/block past some foliage above and a brief crux before gaining easier ground to the top.
content.protection: There are some oddly placed bolts above. There are a few TR anchor options with the right length of anchor material and some creativity.
content.location:
Begin behind the large bushes left of

Unknown Corner

.
